summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: True Blood: Season 1 Review Date: 2009/05/09 Store: Anna Paquin (Actor), Stephen Moyer (Actor) Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, HBO, All HBO Titles Product Description: ['Product Description', 'True Blood: The Complete First Season (DVD)', 'TRUE BLOOD chronicles the backwoods Louisiana town of Bon Temps... where vampires have emerged from the coffin, and no longer need humans for their fix. Sookie Stackhouse (Anna Paquin, Golden Globe(R)-winner for "True Blood", Academy Award®-winner for “The Piano”) works as a waitress at the rural bar Merlotte\'s. Though outwardly a typical young woman, she keeps a dangerous secret: she has the ability to hear the thoughts of others. Her situation is further complicated when the bar gets its first vampire patron - 173-year old Bill Compton (Steven Moyer, "Quills") - and the two outsiders are immediately drawn to each other. Delivering the best of what audiences have come to expect from Creator and Executive Producer Alan Ball (writer of Oscar®-winning Best Picture “American Beauty”, creator of the Emmy® Award-winning HBO® series “Six Feet Under”), TRUE BLOOD is a dark and sexy tale that boldly delves into the heart - and the neck - of the Deep South.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Alan Ball’s', 'True Blood', 'series works well for television, as it has enough sensationalism to tantalize and enough story girth to make the viewer care about the characters. That one can finally invest emotion into monsters, including an undead Civil War victim, a transformer who can shapeshift into various animals, and a female mind reader, speaks volumes about America’s willingness to accept fantasy. Of course, television has always produced good fantasy shows (', 'I Dream of Jeannie', '), but', 'True Blood’s', 'Southern Goth brand of fun horror is more macabre and more perverse, not to mention gorier, than most shows of its kind to date. Adapted from Charlaine Harris’ Sookie Stackhouse novels,', 'True Blood', 'thrills because of its equal blend in each episode of erotica, humor, tragedy, mystery, and fantasy.', 'Set in a rural, swampy Louisiana parrish, the show centers around Sookie Stackhouse (Anna Paquin) and her clan, sweet grandmother Adele (Lois Smith) and air-headed brother Jason (Ryan Kwanten). Illicit love is spawned early on, when Sookie saves vampire Bill Compton (Stephen Moyer) from having his blood stolen in the parking lot of Merlotte’s diner, owned by Sam Merlotte (Sam Trammell) who completes what will form a complex love triangle. As tensions between Sookie’s suitors loosen or tighten, many side plots, such as her African American best friend Tara’s (Rutina Wesley) struggle with an alcoholic, Bible-thumping mother and her brother’s dangerous crush on drug addicted hippie, Amy Burley (Lizzy Caplan), keep one wondering who will succeed in this podunk place. The main tension throughout, however, is a race war waged between vampires and humans. As murders of “fang bangers” occur (human girls who let vampires bite them) and dumb policeman Andy Bellefleur (Chris Bauer) fails to find clues, one sees the metaphorical implications of vampirism and feels deeper resonance with what can be a downright trashy show. Gossip galore, especially about what kinds of babies interbreeding will produce, is rampant. One of the funniest characters is Tara’s flamboyant cousin, Lafayette (Nelsan Ellis), who deals drugs, works as a fry cook, and services the local white politicians, while making sure he’s always up in everyone’s business.', 'What makes', 'True Blood', 'smarter than pure soap opera is the parallels it draws between its monster mash and actual, familiar societal problems. Sookie and her friends watch the news, where Evangelicals bash vampires and prohibit mixed marriage, and everyone is addicted to V, a.k.a vampire blood, that effects like psychedelic heroin. Even its gore reflects a mix of serious and silly, as vampires explode into red, sticky goop. Though it may not be attempting to qualify for the best vampire footage ever shot,', 'True Blood', 'is as addictive as that substance the town’s youth obsesses over, which is a metaphor in itself. --', 'Trinie Dalton', 'Stills from', 'True Blood', '(Click for larger image)'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama, Mystery & Suspense/Thrillers', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, Widescreen, Subtitled, NTSC, Closed-captioned', 'Contributor': 'William Sanderson, Lois Smith, Rutina Wesley, Nelsan Ellis, Sam Trammell, Ryan Kwanten, Lizzy Caplan, Chris Bauer, Anna Paquin, Stephen MoyerWilliam Sanderson, Lois Smith, Rutina Wesley, Nelsan Ellis, Sam Trammell, Ryan Kwanten, Lizzy Caplan, Chris Bauer, Anna Paquin, Stephen Moyer See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '5', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 1.5 inches; 14.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '5069617', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, Widescreen, Subtitled, NTSC, Closed-captioned', 'Run time': '12 hours', 'Release date': 'October 21, 2014', 'Actors': 'Anna Paquin, Stephen Moyer, Sam Trammell, Rutina Wesley, Ryan Kwanten', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish, Portuguese', 'Studio': 'HBO Studios', 'Number of discs': '5'} Review Text: Ok, I enjoyed the books. The TV series doesn't have the feel of the books or stay true to the plot or even the characters. That's OK, it's TV. At first I had trouble with the casting. None of the cast seem to fit the characters in the book... So just accept this is LOOSELY based on the book. I wouldn't buy this season unless it was dirt cheap. You can go online and search/view all the episodes. Watch thru to the ending episode... by that time, you get used to the characters and that is the episode that gives you hope that season two is actually going to be worthwhile....So, if you can actually get through the first 12 episodes.... things might get better.... also go online and see the preview for season two... it looks promising.. Review Title: It could get better... it's like a b grade homemade movie Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Smash: Season 2 Review Date: 2013/12/07 Store: Katharine McPhee (Actor), Debra Messing (Actor) Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Boxed Sets, Drama Product Description: ["In Season Two, Broadway-bound musical Bombshell has competition on its heels in the form of Hit List, a rock musical written by two Broadway newcomers that threatens to tear apart the very fabric of Bombshell's team. As tension mounts on the road to Broadway, new romances are formed, loyalties are betrayed, and rivalries are reignited, all leading up to theater's biggest night -- The Tony Awards. Also starring Tony Award winner Christian Borle (Broadway's Peter and the Starcatcher), Jack Davenport (Pirates of the Caribbean), Krysta Rodriguez and Andy Mientus. Guest starring Academy Award winners Jennifer Hudson (Dreamgirls) and Liza Minnelli (Cabaret), Emmy Award winner Sean Hayes (Will & Grace) and Tony Award winner Bernadette Peters, watch all 17 episodes back-to-back and uninterrupted featuring never-before-seen bonus content including deleted scenes and more!Bonus Content:", 'Deleted Scenes', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Gag Reel', 'Gag Reel'] Average Rating: 4.9 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama, Musicals', 'Format': 'Box set, Multiple Formats, NTSC, Color, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Megan Hilty, Anjelica Huston, Christian Borle, Debra Messing, Jack Davenport, Katharine McPhee', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1)', 'Number Of Discs': '4', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': '26920198', 'Media Format': 'Box set, Multiple Formats, NTSC, Color, Widescreen', 'Run time': '12 hours and 12 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 6, 2013', 'Actors': 'Katharine McPhee, Debra Messing, Jack Davenport, Christian Borle, Megan Hilty', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Number of discs': '4'} Review Text: Reposting a previous review that was spot on - Season 2 doesn't even resemble season one - don't buy wait until it is free to be disappointed....

Season 1 is so amazing! No doubt fans, like myself, were excited for the new season. But, what a disappointment. All of the great Broadway-style music that we loved has been replaced by mediocre Katherine McPhee pop songs. It cheapens the show. The producers fired the shows creator after season 1, and it is flailing. No character development, and all that existed previously is just gone. Julia's family and torrid affair, Karen's split with Dev, Ivy trying desperately to satisfy her over-achieving Broadway legend Mom (Bernadette Peters!) to the extent of a suicide attempt - all of that gone like it never even happened. Nothing. Everything, with the possible exception of an occasionally fabulous Megan Hilty solo, is just painful to watch. Review Title: Don't buy wait until it is free to be disappointed.... Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/09/27 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Hettie Macdonald', "Daniel O'Hara", 'Ed Bazalgette', 'Daniel Nettheim', 'Justin Molotnikov', 'Rachel Talalay'], 'Producers': ['Tracie Simpson', 'Derek Ritchie', 'Nikki Wilson', 'Peter Bennett'], 'Starring': ['Peter Capaldi', 'Jenna Coleman', 'Michelle Gomez'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']} Review Text: Hands down... the best part of the last two seasons.... Michelle Gomez!!!! Review Title: Dr Who? Michelle Gomez! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Supernatural: Season 9 Review Date: 2016/06/28 Store: Jared Padalecki (Actor), Jensen Ackles (Actor) Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama Product Description: ['Supernatural: The Complete Ninth Season (DVD)', 'Sam and Dean have spent their lives on the road, battling every kind of supernatural threat. Over the years, after dozens of bloody adventures, they have faced everything from the yellow-eyed demon that killed their mother to Lucifer and the Leviathan. With the help of allies — both human and supernatural — they’ve discovered that every threat they vanquish opens a new door for evil to enter in. In the show’s eighth season, their supernatural hunting expedition led them directly into an age-old power struggle involving the King of Hell, legions of warrior angels and a series of divine trials to prove themselves worthy of sealing the Gates of Hell forever. With the help of their protector, the angel Castiel, who’s been cast out of heaven with the other angels, Sam and Dean’s lifelong quest to set the supernatural world right again will take everything they’ve got.', ']]>'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama, Horror, Suspense', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Jared Padalecki, McG, Robert Singer, Jeremy Carver, Jensen Ackles, Misha Collins, Adam Glass, Phil SgricciaJared Padalecki, McG, Robert Singer, Jeremy Carver, Jensen Ackles, Misha Collins, Adam Glass, Phil Sgriccia See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Number Of Discs': '6', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 8.8 Ounces', 'Item model number': '828765', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '16 hours and 52 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 9, 2014', 'Actors': 'Jared Padalecki, Jensen Ackles, Misha Collins', 'Producers': 'Robert Singer, Jeremy Carver, Phil Sgriccia, McG, Adam Glass', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '6'} Review Text: Love this series Review Title: Love this series Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/09/20 Average Rating: 4.9 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Español', 'Português'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español', 'Português'], 'Directors': ['Mark Cendrowski', 'Anthony Rich', 'Peter Chakos', 'Nikki Lorre', 'James Burrows', 'Howard Murray', 'Gay Linvill', 'Kristy Cecil', 'Ted Wass', 'Andrew D. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Into The Woods Review Date: 2016/09/20 Store: Meryl Streep (Actor), Emily Blunt (Actor), Rob Marshall (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment, All Disney Titles Product Description: ["From the director of CHICAGO and the producer of WICKED comes a modern twist on the beloved fairy tales you thought you knew. Meryl Streep stars in this epic musical saga about daring to venture INTO THE WOODS. Iconic characters, such as Cinderella, Little Red Riding Hood, Jack and the Beanstalk and Rapunzel, find their fates intertwined with a humble baker and his wife, whose longing to have a child sends them on a quest to reverse a witch's (Streep) curse. With an all-star cast, this spellbinding adventure is everything you could ever wish for."] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Musical', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Meryl Streep, Emily Blunt, Christine Baranski, Based On The Musical By Stephen Sondheim And James, Anna Kendrick, Johnny Depp, James Corden, Chris Pine, Rob Marshall, Tracey Ullman, Screenplay By James LapineMeryl Streep, Emily Blunt, Christine Baranski, Based On The Musical By Stephen Sondheim And James, Anna Kendrick, Johnny Depp, James Corden, Chris Pine, Rob Marshall, Tracey Ullman, Screenplay By James Lapine See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 5 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.39:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.8 Ounces', 'Item model number': '12636100', 'Director': 'Rob Marshall', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '2 hours and 5 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 24, 2015', 'Actors': 'Meryl Streep, Emily Blunt, James Corden, Anna Kendrick, Chris Pine', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, English', 'Studio': 'WALT DISNEY PICTURES', 'Writers': 'Screenplay By James Lapine, Based On The Musical By Stephen Sondheim And James', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Fun, I enjoyed it. The interaction between the companions and the problems in the companion's lives take center stage... the companions have more face time than Dr Who....and quite frankly we no longer care... Good news! There won't be another episode until 2020... Review Title: Where is Dr Who? Review Title: Absolutely embarassing... pathectic..couldn't watch it.. after I paid for it... Rating: 1.0 --------------------------------------------------

True Blood: Season 1 Anna Paquin (Actor), Stephen Moyer (Actor) Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, HBO, All HBO Titles ['Product Description', 'True Blood: The Complete First Season (DVD)', 'TRUE BLOOD chronicles the backwoods Louisiana town of Bon Temps... where vampires have emerged from the coffin, and no longer need humans for their fix. Sookie Stackhouse (Anna Paquin, Golden Globe(R)-winner for "True Blood", Academy Award®-winner for “The Piano”) works as a waitress at the rural bar Merlotte\'s. Though outwardly a typical young woman, she keeps a dangerous secret: she has the ability to hear the thoughts of others. Her situation is further complicated when the bar gets its first vampire patron - 173-year old Bill Compton (Steven Moyer, "Quills") - and the two outsiders are immediately drawn to each other. Delivering the best of what audiences have come to expect from Creator and Executive Producer Alan Ball (writer of Oscar®-winning Best Picture “American Beauty”, creator of the Emmy® Award-winning HBO® series “Six Feet Under”), TRUE BLOOD is a dark and sexy tale that boldly delves into the heart - and the neck - of the Deep South.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Alan Ball’s', 'True Blood', 'series works well for television, as it has enough sensationalism to tantalize and enough story girth to make the viewer care about the characters. That one can finally invest emotion into monsters, including an undead Civil War victim, a transformer who can shapeshift into various animals, and a female mind reader, speaks volumes about America’s willingness to accept fantasy. Of course, television has always produced good fantasy shows (', 'I Dream of Jeannie', '), but', 'True Blood’s', 'Southern Goth brand of fun horror is more macabre and more perverse, not to mention gorier, than most shows of its kind to date. Adapted from Charlaine Harris’ Sookie Stackhouse novels,', 'True Blood', 'thrills because of its equal blend in each episode of erotica, humor, tragedy, mystery, and fantasy.', 'Set in a rural, swampy Louisiana parrish, the show centers around Sookie Stackhouse (Anna Paquin) and her clan, sweet grandmother Adele (Lois Smith) and air-headed brother Jason (Ryan Kwanten). Illicit love is spawned early on, when Sookie saves vampire Bill Compton (Stephen Moyer) from having his blood stolen in the parking lot of Merlotte’s diner, owned by Sam Merlotte (Sam Trammell) who completes what will form a complex love triangle. As tensions between Sookie’s suitors loosen or tighten, many side plots, such as her African American best friend Tara’s (Rutina Wesley) struggle with an alcoholic, Bible-thumping mother and her brother’s dangerous crush on drug addicted hippie, Amy Burley (Lizzy Caplan), keep one wondering who will succeed in this podunk place. The main tension throughout, however, is a race war waged between vampires and humans. As murders of “fang bangers” occur (human girls who let vampires bite them) and dumb policeman Andy Bellefleur (Chris Bauer) fails to find clues, one sees the metaphorical implications of vampirism and feels deeper resonance with what can be a downright trashy show. Gossip galore, especially about what kinds of babies interbreeding will produce, is rampant. One of the funniest characters is Tara’s flamboyant cousin, Lafayette (Nelsan Ellis), who deals drugs, works as a fry cook, and services the local white politicians, while making sure he’s always up in everyone’s business.', 'What makes', 'True Blood', 'smarter than pure soap opera is the parallels it draws between its monster mash and actual, familiar societal problems. Sookie and her friends watch the news, where Evangelicals bash vampires and prohibit mixed marriage, and everyone is addicted to V, a.k.a vampire blood, that effects like psychedelic heroin. Even its gore reflects a mix of serious and silly, as vampires explode into red, sticky goop. Though it may not be attempting to qualify for the best vampire footage ever shot,', 'True Blood', 'is as addictive as that substance the town’s youth obsesses over, which is a metaphor in itself. --', 'Trinie Dalton', 'Stills from', 'True Blood', '(Click for larger image)'] {'Genre': 'Drama, Mystery & Suspense/Thrillers', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, Widescreen, Subtitled, NTSC, Closed-captioned', 'Contributor': 'William Sanderson, Lois Smith, Rutina Wesley, Nelsan Ellis, Sam Trammell, Ryan Kwanten, Lizzy Caplan, Chris Bauer, Anna Paquin, Stephen MoyerWilliam Sanderson, Lois Smith, Rutina Wesley, Nelsan Ellis, Sam Trammell, Ryan Kwanten, Lizzy Caplan, Chris Bauer, Anna Paquin, Stephen Moyer See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '5', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 1.5 inches; 14.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '5069617', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, Widescreen, Subtitled, NTSC, Closed-captioned', 'Run time': '12 hours', 'Release date': 'October 21, 2014', 'Actors': 'Anna Paquin, Stephen Moyer, Sam Trammell, Rutina Wesley, Ryan Kwanten', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish, Portuguese', 'Studio': 'HBO Studios', 'Number of discs': '5'} Ok, I enjoyed the books. The TV series doesn't have the feel of the books or stay true to the plot or even the characters. That's OK, it's TV. At first I had trouble with the casting. Season 1 is so amazing! No doubt fans, like myself, were excited for the new season. But, what a disappointment. All of the great Broadway-style music that we loved has been replaced by mediocre Katherine McPhee pop songs. It cheapens the show. The producers fired the shows creator after season 1, and it is flailing. No character development, and all that existed previously is just gone. Julia's family and torrid affair, Karen's split with Dev, Ivy trying desperately to satisfy her over-achieving Broadway legend Mom (Bernadette Peters!) to the extent of a suicide attempt - all of that gone like it never even happened. Nothing. Everything, with the possible exception of an occasionally fabulous Megan Hilty solo, is just painful to watch. Supernatural: Season 9 Jared Padalecki (Actor), Jensen Ackles (Actor) Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama ['Supernatural: The Complete Ninth Season (DVD)', 'Sam and Dean have spent their lives on the road, battling every kind of supernatural threat. Over the years, after dozens of bloody adventures, they have faced everything from the yellow-eyed demon that killed their mother to Lucifer and the Leviathan. With the help of allies — both human and supernatural — they’ve discovered that every threat they vanquish opens a new door for evil to enter in. In the show’s eighth season, their supernatural hunting expedition led them directly into an age-old power struggle involving the King of Hell, legions of warrior angels and a series of divine trials to prove themselves worthy of sealing the Gates of Hell forever. prompt:
Based on this purchase history, analyze and summarize this person's genuine preferences and patterns in under 256 words. Think step by step: 1. First, identify consistent patterns in ratings and sentiments 2. Next, observe common themes across product purposes and use cases 3. Then, note recurring quality preferences and price sensitivity patterns 4. Finally, synthesize these observations into core preferences Remember to: - Focus only on keywords and trends supported by multiple interactions - Avoid repeating specific product names or details - Base conclusions strictly on the provided purchase data Here's the purchase data: === Purchase Information === Product Title: True Blood: Season 1 Review Date: 2009/05/09 Store: Anna Paquin (Actor), Stephen Moyer (Actor) Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, HBO, All HBO Titles Product Description: ['Product Description', 'True Blood: The Complete First Season (DVD)', 'TRUE BLOOD chronicles the backwoods Louisiana town of Bon Temps... where vampires have emerged from the coffin, and no longer need humans for their fix. Sookie Stackhouse (Anna Paquin, Golden Globe(R)-winner for "True Blood", Academy Award®-winner for “The Piano”) works as a waitress at the rural bar Merlotte\'s. Though outwardly a typical young woman, she keeps a dangerous secret: she has the ability to hear the thoughts of others. Her situation is further complicated when the bar gets its first vampire patron - 173-year old Bill Compton (Steven Moyer, "Quills") - and the two outsiders are immediately drawn to each other. Delivering the best of what audiences have come to expect from Creator and Executive Producer Alan Ball (writer of Oscar®-winning Best Picture “American Beauty”, creator of the Emmy® Award-winning HBO® series “Six Feet Under”), TRUE BLOOD is a dark and sexy tale that boldly delves into the heart - and the neck - of the Deep South.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Alan Ball’s', 'True Blood', 'series works well for television, as it has enough sensationalism to tantalize and enough story girth to make the viewer care about the characters. That one can finally invest emotion into monsters, including an undead Civil War victim, a transformer who can shapeshift into various animals, and a female mind reader, speaks volumes about America’s willingness to accept fantasy. Of course, television has always produced good fantasy shows (', 'I Dream of Jeannie', '), but', 'True Blood’s', 'Southern Goth brand of fun horror is more macabre and more perverse, not to mention gorier, than most shows of its kind to date. Adapted from Charlaine Harris’ Sookie Stackhouse novels,', 'True Blood', 'thrills because of its equal blend in each episode of erotica, humor, tragedy, mystery, and fantasy.', 'Set in a rural, swampy Louisiana parrish, the show centers around Sookie Stackhouse (Anna Paquin) and her clan, sweet grandmother Adele (Lois Smith) and air-headed brother Jason (Ryan Kwanten). Illicit love is spawned early on, when Sookie saves vampire Bill Compton (Stephen Moyer) from having his blood stolen in the parking lot of Merlotte’s diner, owned by Sam Merlotte (Sam Trammell) who completes what will form a complex love triangle. As tensions between Sookie’s suitors loosen or tighten, many side plots, such as her African American best friend Tara’s (Rutina Wesley) struggle with an alcoholic, Bible-thumping mother and her brother’s dangerous crush on drug addicted hippie, Amy Burley (Lizzy Caplan), keep one wondering who will succeed in this podunk place. The main tension throughout, however, is a race war waged between vampires and humans. As murders of “fang bangers” occur (human girls who let vampires bite them) and dumb policeman Andy Bellefleur (Chris Bauer) fails to find clues, one sees the metaphorical implications of vampirism and feels deeper resonance with what can be a downright trashy show. Gossip galore, especially about what kinds of babies interbreeding will produce, is rampant. One of the funniest characters is Tara’s flamboyant cousin, Lafayette (Nelsan Ellis), who deals drugs, works as a fry cook, and services the local white politicians, while making sure he’s always up in everyone’s business.', 'What makes', 'True Blood', 'smarter than pure soap opera is the parallels it draws between its monster mash and actual, familiar societal problems. Sookie and her friends watch the news, where Evangelicals bash vampires and prohibit mixed marriage, and everyone is addicted to V, a.k.a vampire blood, that effects like psychedelic heroin. Even its gore reflects a mix of serious and silly, as vampires explode into red, sticky goop. Though it may not be attempting to qualify for the best vampire footage ever shot,', 'True Blood', 'is as addictive as that substance the town’s youth obsesses over, which is a metaphor in itself. --', 'Trinie Dalton', 'Stills from', 'True Blood', '(Click for larger image)'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama, Mystery & Suspense/Thrillers', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, Widescreen, Subtitled, NTSC, Closed-captioned', 'Contributor': 'William Sanderson, Lois Smith, Rutina Wesley, Nelsan Ellis, Sam Trammell, Ryan Kwanten, Lizzy Caplan, Chris Bauer, Anna Paquin, Stephen MoyerWilliam Sanderson, Lois Smith, Rutina Wesley, Nelsan Ellis, Sam Trammell, Ryan Kwanten, Lizzy Caplan, Chris Bauer, Anna Paquin, Stephen Moyer See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '5', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 1.5 inches; 14.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '5069617', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, Widescreen, Subtitled, NTSC, Closed-captioned', 'Run time': '12 hours', 'Release date': 'October 21, 2014', 'Actors': 'Anna Paquin, Stephen Moyer, Sam Trammell, Rutina Wesley, Ryan Kwanten', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish, Portuguese', 'Studio': 'HBO Studios', 'Number of discs': '5'} Review Text: Ok, I enjoyed the books. The TV series doesn't have the feel of the books or stay true to the plot or even the characters. That's OK, it's TV. At first I had trouble with the casting. None of the cast seem to fit the characters in the book... So just accept this is LOOSELY based on the book. I wouldn't buy this season unless it was dirt cheap. You can go online and search/view all the episodes. Watch thru to the ending episode... by that time, you get used to the characters and that is the episode that gives you hope that season two is actually going to be worthwhile....So, if you can actually get through the first 12 episodes.... things might get better.... also go online and see the preview for season two... it looks promising.. Review Title: It could get better... it's like a b grade homemade movie Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Smash: Season 2 Review Date: 2013/12/07 Store: Katharine McPhee (Actor), Debra Messing (Actor) Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Boxed Sets, Drama Product Description: ["In Season Two, Broadway-bound musical Bombshell has competition on its heels in the form of Hit List, a rock musical written by two Broadway newcomers that threatens to tear apart the very fabric of Bombshell's team. As tension mounts on the road to Broadway, new romances are formed, loyalties are betrayed, and rivalries are reignited, all leading up to theater's biggest night -- The Tony Awards. Also starring Tony Award winner Christian Borle (Broadway's Peter and the Starcatcher), Jack Davenport (Pirates of the Caribbean), Krysta Rodriguez and Andy Mientus. Guest starring Academy Award winners Jennifer Hudson (Dreamgirls) and Liza Minnelli (Cabaret), Emmy Award winner Sean Hayes (Will & Grace) and Tony Award winner Bernadette Peters, watch all 17 episodes back-to-back and uninterrupted featuring never-before-seen bonus content including deleted scenes and more!Bonus Content:", 'Deleted Scenes', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Gag Reel', 'Gag Reel'] Average Rating: 4.9 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama, Musicals', 'Format': 'Box set, Multiple Formats, NTSC, Color, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Megan Hilty, Anjelica Huston, Christian Borle, Debra Messing, Jack Davenport, Katharine McPhee', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1)', 'Number Of Discs': '4', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': '26920198', 'Media Format': 'Box set, Multiple Formats, NTSC, Color, Widescreen', 'Run time': '12 hours and 12 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 6, 2013', 'Actors': 'Katharine McPhee, Debra Messing, Jack Davenport, Christian Borle, Megan Hilty', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Number of discs': '4'} Review Text: Reposting a previous review that was spot on - Season 2 doesn't even resemble season one - don't buy wait until it is free to be disappointed....

Season 1 is so amazing! No doubt fans, like myself, were excited for the new season. But, what a disappointment. All of the great Broadway-style music that we loved has been replaced by mediocre Katherine McPhee pop songs. It cheapens the show. The producers fired the shows creator after season 1, and it is flailing. No character development, and all that existed previously is just gone. Julia's family and torrid affair, Karen's split with Dev, Ivy trying desperately to satisfy her over-achieving Broadway legend Mom (Bernadette Peters!) to the extent of a suicide attempt - all of that gone like it never even happened. Nothing. Everything, with the possible exception of an occasionally fabulous Megan Hilty solo, is just painful to watch. Review Title: Don't buy wait until it is free to be disappointed.... raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The analysis of this purchase history reveals a strong preference for fantasy and drama genres, particularly those featuring complex characters and intertwining narratives. Consistently high ratings, particularly for series like "Supernatural" and "Doctor Who," suggest an appreciation for imaginative storytelling and character development. A notable pattern of disappointment arises with sequels or continued seasons, as seen in reviews for "Smash" and "True Blood," indicating that the individual values stays true to initial character arcs and quality of writing, resulting in price sensitivity toward sequel purchases (preferring deeper discounts).

Quality preferences lean towards productions showcasing strong performances, often by well-known actors or within recognizable franchises, which enhance their viewing experience. The varied sentiment in reviews reflects both admiration and critical assessment, particularly highlighting when a series deviates from previous successes.

Price sensitivity is evident through comments advocating for not purchasing new seasons unless at a significantly reduced price. Overall, this individual clearly enjoys engaging narratives that resonate with complex societal issues, enjoys rich character portrayals, and prefers high-quality productions that maintain their initial charm and consistency.
